title: autologged model signature uses estimator.predict instead of predictor column ?
body:
**Steps to reproduce:**

1) Turn on autologging.
2) Produce a Pandas DataFrame with X input columns and y predictor column which is of data type string.
3) Instantiate an XGBoostClassifier (or any other sklearn model) and fit on X and y.

**Expected behavior:**

infer_signature(X, y) is equal to the model signature logged in MLFlow.

**Actual behavior:**

infer_signature(X,y) produces .... "outputs: [string]" 

MLFlow model signature produces .... "outputs: [Tensor('object', (-1,))]"

**Root cause**

1) autolog calls infer_signature(X, estimator.predict(X)) instead of infer_signature(X,y)
2) estimator.predict(X) returns a numpy.ndarray
3) Pandas dataFrame strings are dtype('O'), i.e. objects
4) infer_signature calls _infer_schema
5) _infer_schema on a Pandas series of strings returns "string"; _infer_schema on a numpy.ndarray returns a Tensor, and sets the dtype as object

See also this test, which should be extended to assert that the two signatures above are not equal
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/9c934f5a57cc8701475eb7ed0b6b072600b66bed/tests/xgboost/test_xgboost_model_export.py#L83

**Recommended fix**

Infer output in the model signature from the predictor column, not the estimator's predict type.
